decisionProcess.title: Your Repeatable Decision Process
decisionProcess.subtitle: Use this checklist every time you connect to public Wi-Fi:
decisionProcess.step1Desc: Ask staff for the exact network name. Don't trust similar-looking names.
decisionProcess.step2Desc: Prefer networks with a lock icon (password-protected). Open networks are riskier.
decisionProcess.step3Desc: Before doing anything sensitive, turn on your VPN to encrypt all traffic.
decisionProcess.step4Desc: Banking or passwords? Wait for a secure network. Just browsing? Proceed with caution.
decisionProcess.step5Desc: Decline any prompts to install apps, profiles, or certificates from portals.

rogueHotspot.title: What is a Rogue Hotspot?
rogueHotspot.description: A rogue hotspot (also called an 'evil twin') is a fake Wi-Fi network set up by an attacker to look like a legitimate one. When you connect, they can see your traffic, steal passwords, or redirect you to fake websites.
rogueHotspot.spot1: Names that look almost right but have small differences (hyphens, underscores, extra words)
rogueHotspot.spot2: Networks claiming to be 'FREE' versions of business networks
rogueHotspot.spot3: Open networks with unusually strong signals
rogueHotspot.spot4: Multiple networks with very similar names

tips.useVpn: Use a VPN on all public networks, especially for sensitive tasks
tips.verifyNetworks: Always verify network names with staff before connecting
tips.neverInstall: Never install apps or profiles from captive portals
tips.postponeSensitive: Postpone sensitive tasks like banking until you're on a secure network
tips.useMobileData: Consider using mobile data instead of public Wi-Fi for critical tasks
tips.cautionHighTraffic: Be extra cautious in high-traffic areas like airports and hotels
tips.greatJob: Great job! Keep using VPN and verifying networks
tips.sharePractices: Share these security practices with colleagues and family
